divs: sighting details i've seen sightings from my area on here and most of them are explained by wolf's furniture's "spot light sale" in near-by altoona, pa. they do it once a year and it can be seen from as far as ebensburg(30miles away). i also jumped to conclusions when i first saw the display of circling lights. as far as the "jumping" light that changes from white to red to blue... what you are witnessing is a star. the red and blue are a result of scattering. white light is made up of red,o,y,g,blue,i,and v. i'll bet you if you watch it close enough you'll also notice the o,y,and g. as for the jumping, that is a trick your own eyes are playing on you because of a light target and a dark reference point(usually a pine tree). obviously i am or was a skeptic. april of 2005 this all changed! i am now a believer but still very logical. my girlfriend and i were travelling on old22 from cresson summit toward cresson. half way down the hill i noticed a very bright star in the horizon. i pointed it out to my girlfriend. suddenly she said it turned blue and i looked to find it to be true. it was then obvious that this was a moving object coming in our direction. when it was about a mile away and approaching it was now red (still only seemed to be a single light). we made it to the rite-aid parking lot and got out to watch as it flew overhead. i saw at least 50 other people whom should have noticed. when it flew over sheetz (gas station where there were many oblivious patrons),it was approx. 200' off the ground and completely silent.we now could see 5 red lights stretching at least 40' apart from each other. i want to say it was v shaped but it was imperfect. we jumped in the car and followed it back up the hill toward rt.220. my car was going the same speed as the object. 35mph. we entered the highway to persue when it stopped only to start travelling back down the hill(toward the direction it came). as it turned around, i started to blink my headlights to see if i could coax a reaction. it just kept going. i had to drive to the next exit (gallitzin) in order to turn around and get back to cresson to follow. by the time we got to cresson summit exit, we could not find it anywhere. a couple days later, i was sitting in the parking lot at work still trying to make sense of it. i thought it must have been a helicopter. then i noticed in the distance a helicopter about 1000\2000' in the air. i did not even have to get out of the car to hear it. i am amazed with what we saw and would like somebody's logial explanation. by the way, i also noticed , in the following days, cresson's electrical supply (i think it's called a sub-station... i don't know the term...it's a bunch of xfmr's and towers and what not)is right under where it turned around....
